question: int x = 5; if (x > 0) { System.out.println("Positive"); } else { System.out.println("Negative"); }
wrongAnswers:
x = 5
if x > 0:
    print("Positive")
print("Negative")

question: int choice = 2; switch (choice) { case 1: System.out.println("One"); break; case 2: System.out.println("Two"); break; default: System.out.println("Invalid Choice"); }
for (int i = 1; i <= 5; i++) { System.out.println(i); }
wrongAnswers:
for i in range(1, 6):
    print("i")

for i in range(1, 6, 1):
    print(i)

for i in range(5, 0, -1):
    print(i)

question: int i = 0; while (i < 5) { System.out.println(i); i++; }
wrongAnswers:
i = 0
while i < 5:
    print(i)
    i++

i = 0
while i < 5:
    print(i)
    i = i + 1

i = 0
while i != 5:
    print(i)
    i++

question: int[] numbers = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}; for (int number : numbers) { System.out.println(number); }
int age = 18; if (age >= 18) { System.out.println("Adult"); } else { System.out.println("Child"); }
boolean flag = false; if (flag) { System.out.println("True"); } else { System.out.println("False"); }
int x = 10; int y = 5; if (x > y) { System.out.println("x is greater than y"); } else { System.out.println("y is greater than x"); }

boolean condition1 = true; boolean condition2 = false; if (condition1 && condition2) { System.out.println("Both conditions are true"); } else { System.out.println("At least one condition is false"); }
int number = 7; if (number % 2 == 0) { System.out.println("Even"); } else { System.out.println("Odd"); }
